EN

Pi Network's PI token has crashed to a new all-time low under $0.135, plunging over 30% in the last month and more than 95% from its all-time high in February 2025. The token's decline comes amid a broader cryptocurrency market downturn, with significant selling pressure expected to continue due to an upcoming token unlock schedule. Nearly 8 million coins will be freed monthly on average, with spikes to over 18 million on February 12 and 23.6 million on February 13, which could lead to more immediate selling from investors waiting to trade their holdings.

Key Points

  • PI token crashed to new all-time low under $0.135, down over 30% in a month and 95% from its ATH
  • Significant token unlocks coming (8M monthly average, spiking to 18M+ on Feb 12 and 23.6M on Feb 13)
  • Some community members remain optimistic despite the bearish trend
  • Token unlocks will normalize after February 20, potentially easing selling pressure
  • Rumors suggest Kraken exchange might list PI token, which could boost liquidity and legitimacy

Article

Millions and millions of PI tokens will be released in the following weeks, which could bring even more pain for the bulls. The past several weeks have not been kind to the cryptocurrency markets. This trend only intensified on Thursday when the entire market bled out, with multiple double-digit price crashers. Naturally, Pi Network‚Äôs PI token was not spared, and it dumped to fresh all-time lows of under $0.135 (on CoinGecko). This meant that the asset has plunged by over 30% in the last month alone. On a broader scale, PI is down by more than 95% since its all-time high marked on February 26, 2025. Despite this massive correction, some members of the ever-vocal and optimistic Pi Network community tried to find the silver linings. This one, for example, outlined the skyrocketing PI transaction volume, which, he believes, shows ‚Äúincreased interest in PI despite the manipulation games done by whales.‚Äù This one was even more bullish, predicting a mind-blowing surge to $4 from the current dip in the first six months after the second Mainnet migration and once old Pioneers (Pi Network users and investors) are done selling off. More Pain to Come? If we are being realistic, it‚Äôs hard to even imagine such a rally happening soon. Not only because the overall crypto market seems to be dominated by the bears, but also due to PI‚Äôs recent price performance and the unlocking schedule for new tokens. Data from PiScan shows that almost 8 million coins will be freed in the next month on average. What‚Äôs even more worrying is the fact that this number will skyrocket to over 18 million on February 12 and to 23.6 million on February 13. Such a massive number of tokens to be unlocked might result in more immediate selling pressure from investors who have been waiting a long time for their holdings to become available for trading. This is particularly true in such a time of panic. You may also like: Bitcoin (BTC) Plunges Before the FOMC Meeting, Pi Network (PI) Soars by 15%: Market Watch Pi Token Unlock Schedule. Source: PiScan The Good News On the positive side, the chart above demonstrates that the number of unlocked tokens will decline after February 20 and will normalize, which could ease the selling pressure. Additionally, there are rumors circulating online that one of the largest and oldest exchanges, Kraken, might be planning to list Pi Network‚Äôs native token, which could boost its liquidity and legitimacy among investors. üö® BREAKING: Kraken Exchange is preparing to integrate the Pi blockchain and list $PI for trading üëÄ If confirmed, this could be a major step for Pi ecosystem adoption. ‚Å∞Eyes on what comes next. #PiNetwork #PI #Kraken #CryptoNews #Altcoins pic.twitter.com/BAWZLcGQnH ‚Äî SMC KAPIL DEV (@smckapildev) February 6, 2026 SPECIAL OFFER (Exclusive) SECRET PARTNERSHIP BONUS for CryptoPotato readers: Use this link to register and unlock $1,500 in exclusive BingX Exchange rewards (limited time offer).
